findings.title: Re-entrancy vulnerability in withdraw
findings.explanation: The contract makes an external call to msg.sender before updating the user's balance. A malicious contract can re-enter the withdraw function during the call and drain funds beyond their credit.
findings.fix_suggestion: Follow the Checks-Effects-Interactions pattern by subtracting the amount from the user's balance before making the external call, or use transfer/send which forwards limited gas.

findings.title: Unchecked low-level call
findings.explanation: The low-level call msg.sender.call.value(amount)() returns a boolean indicating success, but the return value is never checked. If the call fails, the contract still proceeds without reverting, potentially leaving inconsistent state.
findings.fix_suggestion: Check the return value of the call using require(res) or use transfer() which throws on failure.
